column5: I got it the day it switched..I wanted the car before it though.

Then I started bleeding for over a month. Not the only experience Iâ€™ve had with extended periods either. Definitely get checked out.

Hope Iâ€™m not asking something too personal, but Did you have nausea and bowel problems when you first started it? My body did not like the instant release when I tried to switch..

Usually itâ€™s prescribed to be taken with meals. Iâ€™ve been on 1500mg ER for 3 years. It definitely helps to eat! My old dr tried switching mine after 2 years and adding 500mg and I got super sick 3 weeks later. Not necessarily true for everyone, but a verifiable side effect.
Happened to my mother in law all the way till she finally hit menopause. Sheâ€™d get super sick too.

Thatâ€™s how a lot of it started. It started as a crush because I was getting more attention from this friend than him. But weâ€™ve worked out a lot over the years and now that Iâ€™m actually out to him as bi(long story, came out in December and everything is Gucci) as well as our relationship is stronger in every aspect. Itâ€™s just a constant itch that I want to scratch, but if I do, itâ€™ll just open up wounds. Iâ€™m looking for a way to heal that without taking that route.

I know they didnâ€™t do the best job of representation but Korra and Asami from Legend of Korra! Both strong characters in their own way and also bi!
Ok but what about plus size flannels? Iâ€™ve never been so comfortable with a look till I started wearing them but Iâ€™m plus size and Torrid is too expensive.

Oof I had zero intention of meaning those things to be bad! My apologies. I listed them because theyâ€™re assumptions Iâ€™ve come across, specifically from straightsâ„¢. I only have issue with people that would /assume/ those things of a bi person ğŸ˜…

That we donâ€™t exist, that itâ€™s a phase, weâ€™re more likely to cheat, we only want threesomes/poly relationships, weâ€™re hypersexual, weâ€™re only claiming bi bc we want to â€œmake the other side happyâ€(straights vs gays)

Throw the whole gf away. Threats and manipulation donâ€™t lead to healthy changes. Even if you stuck it out AND managed to better your health by her standards, what else could happen in the future? Being a douche bag is never good for someone trying to better themselves. Also, even though you â€œcould be doing moreâ€, every little thing youâ€™re doing is a step forward and should be followed with encouragement.

Whatâ€™s left? Stick around and find out. Things can only get better. Itâ€™s really difficult to manage what youâ€™re going through, I totally feel you. But Youâ€™re not alone. And thatâ€™s not to invalidate your feelings at all. Shit really blows sometimes, and a lot of the time a bunch blows up at once. But in the long run itâ€™s worth it not to give up. I have to remind myself of that every day. But itâ€™s so so true. Much love to you, friend ğŸ’œ
